intro: Pitardia nepetoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved germander, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Pitardia nepetoides is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
